title: How much power should supports have until they become unhealthy?
body:
Lets take a scenario:

 A fed assassin/diver jumps an adc but, is blocked by a janna who ends up everything to protect the adc. This protection ends up allowing the adc to auto attack and kill the assassin due to blowing all their cooldowns. My question is that is the protection and invalidating the assassins burst unhealthy? If we look at if from the perspective of the assassin yes it is. This is because it feels awful to useless and completely invalidated.  However, if we look at it from the perspective of the support its healthy because the supports job was to peel and they did what they needed to do. If the opposite happened, and the protection did not matter and the assassin ended up killing the adc would not it feel bad for the support player that their peel was useless?

##So at what point is the supports peel toxic?

###### just want a discussion tbh I dont really know the answer

replies.body:
Use some strategy man. Janna can only shield her ADC OR herself, not both. Just bait out her shield by diving at her ADC, then kill her instead.
The support is indeed powerful. But that's all the more reason you need to shut them down. Don't think your roam was a failure if you don't kill the ADC. As long as you took out one botlaner you've made laning nearly impossible for the other, at least until he gets his partner back.

The answer fundamentally depends on a lot of variables that your not talking about.

1.) How fed is the assassin vs the support - what is the level and/or gold difference

2.) How well did the Assassin set up the gank and execute it? Did it take a lot of skill to perform? 

3.) How well did the Janna stop the gank and prevent it? Did it take a lot of skill to perform? 

Answer those for me, and we can proceed.
